node.title: Launceston airport sues agency over lack of PFAS plan
node.alt: Fire fighter sprays foam on a fire
node.description: Potentially toxic firefighting chemicals were found in fish pulled from a river near Launceston Airport two years ago. Now the airport is taking legal action to make the government do something about it.
node.content:
["Tasmania's second-largest airport is suing a federal government agency over what it claims is a failure to clean-up potentially toxic\u00a0firefighting chemicals.\u00a0", "Launceston Airport has filed a statement of claim in the Federal Court alleging\u00a0Airservices Australia, which provides firefighting services at the airport,\u00a0has not presented a detailed enough plan to deal with PFAS contamination.\u00a0", "PFAS \u2013 per and polyfluoroalkyl substances \u2013\u00a0are a group of manufactured chemicals that have been used in firefighting foams since the 1950s and have been linked to possible severe health effects in animals and humans.\u00a0", "The chemicals have been found in low levels at the airport and in fish living in part of a river that is fed by nearby streams.\u00a0", "
Court action a 'last resort'
", "Airservices Australia has\u00a0had\u00a0subleases at Launceston Airport since the 1990s and carried out\u00a0firefighting drills with foam products containing PFAS chemicals until 2010.", "A 2019 preliminary site investigation by the agency\u00a0detected low levels of PFAS in soil and sediment within the Launceston Airport and in groundwater, although the report noted the area relied on a reticulated water supply.\u00a0", "", "
The airport's chief executive says he does not\u00a0believe Airservices are \"serious about rectifying the issues that have been raised about PFAS\".(ABC News: Casey Briggs)
", "Under the terms of its sub-lease, Airservices Australia has to provide a detailed environmental management plan (EMP) if there is a reasonable likelihood that contamination has occurred\u00a0and then carry out all its on-site operations in line with that plan.", "Launceston Airport's management is arguing the PFAS chemicals detected on site fit\u00a0the definition of\u00a0contaminants \u2014 but in court documents said the\u00a0draft management plan provided by Airservices Australia in\u00a02018 did not provide enough detail about\u00a0how it was going to be managed.\u00a0", "\u00a0Launceston Airport chief executive, Shane O'Hare, said the process had been going on for years and court action was a \"last resort\".", "\"We have had countless mediation sessions, probably up to 17 or 18 meetings with them over the past three years alone,\" he said.", "
Fishing ban still in place two years on
", "In its response filed with the court,\u00a0Airservices rejected the argument that PFAS was a contaminant under the definition in\u00a0its sub-leases and said the requirement for an EMP did not mean it had to\u00a0actually\u00a0set out steps for removal or remediation.", "", "
Health advice warns people not to eat fish taken from one part of the North Esk river.\u00a0(ABC News\u00a0)
", "It\u00a0argued it had fulfilled its obligations by providing a revised EMP in November\u00a0and suggested\u00a0two PFAS chemicals may have entered the soil, surface water and groundwater from other sources, not related to airport firefighting.\u00a0", "They included from a\u00a0fuel depot, a former wastewater retention pond and from agricultural chemicals used by local farmers.", "Mr O'Hare said the ongoing delays were\u00a0having a real impact\u00a0on neighbours.\u00a0", "\"We're not suing for money,\" he said.", "\"What we're taking them to court over is to provide us with an action plan on what they will need to do to make good the contamination of the airport site and to ensure no further seepage of PFAS into the airport or our neighbouring properties.\"", "", "
PFAS chemicals have been detected in creeks near Launceston Airport.\u00a0(ABC News: Manika Dadson)
", "A Tasmanian Health Department study, prompted by the Airservices Australia inquiry in 2019, found PFAS chemicals in three creeks draining from Launceston Airport into the North Esk River.", "Some fish were found to\u00a0contain a\u00a0PFAS chemical above the acceptable level and the\u00a0department issued a health advisory warning people not to eat those caught downstream of Corra Linn Gorge.", "That advisory remains in place, more than two years later.", "In a statement, an\u00a0Airservices Australia spokeswoman said it would be inappropriate to comment on the court matter, but said the agency was working with\u00a0Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority (EPA) and regulators to identify reasonable measures to address PFAS contamination.\u00a0", "It said\u00a0Airservices had conducted PFAS sampling for PFAS on private land near Launceston Airport last year but did not reveal the findings.\u00a0", "
Responsibility to uphold 'clean,\u00a0green' reputation: airport
", "Greens senator Peter Whish-Wilson said Airservices should release the detailed site investigation now.", "\"I understand they're talking with landholders privately and they're working through the Tasmanian EPA,but this a matter of significant public interest and concern.\"", "About $130 million was allocated in the last federal budget for investigations into PFAS risk at Australian airports and the development of management plans.", "The Federal Department of Infrastructure, Transport, Regional Development and Communications did not respond to questions about where the money was going but said government was \"working closely with airports \u2026\u00a0(on) developing robust management plans and funding allocations\".", "Senator Whish-Wilson said it was \"quite extraordinary\" that a private commercial organisation was being forced to sue a government body.\u00a0", "Mr O'Hare said the PFAS contamination added to the airport's costs by slowing down maintenance and construction work, but there was also a major environmental concern.", "\"Tasmania has a reputation for being clean and green and it's everybody's responsibility to make sure we uphold that reputation but also do the right when something that a\u00a0corporation or organisation has done affects the environment,\" he said.\u00a0", "A trial date has been set for September."]
